intro: Erica blaerioides subsp. blaerioides, commonly known as the coastal heath, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. It plays an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for local wildlife. Erica blaerioides subsp. blaerioides is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and landscaping.
